name: intermarry

to marry someone from a different social group, race, or religion: Many of the immigrants have intermarried with the island's original inhabitants. These native people coexisted with the Spanish for about 150 years, sometimes intermarrying.
to marry someone who is from the same family as you: Families have intermarried over the decades so that husbands and wives commonly are stepsiblings and cousins. See
intermarriage
